title: Hotel, motel and pub selling spree
text:
The O'Donnell family has offloaded Goulburn's Empire Hotel to a private buyer for $3.55 million.

The pub, which returns an annual revenue of $1.3 million, sits on a 1587sq m site with development potential. It also has 9 rooms.

HTL Property's Sam Handy and Blake Edwards brokered the deal.

Mill Park Medical

An investor has forked out $9.045 million for a medical property at 14D Oleander Drive in Melbourne's Mill Park.

Melbourne Health, a subsidiary of The Royal Melbourne Hospital, occupies the 1188sq m property, paying a net annual rent of $422,155. The sale closed at a yield of 4.6 per cent.

Knight Frank’s Tim Grant and Tom Ryan, in conjunction with Gorman Commercial, brokered the deal.

Strata office record

Advertisement

Property consultant David Hodgson’s Hodgson Partners has paid $4.75 million for a whole floor office at the ACCI House building at 55 Exhibition Street in the Melbourne CBD.

The purchase follows the firm's earlier acquisition of an entire 6-level office building at 45 Exhibition Street.

David Hodgson’s Hodgson Partners has paid $4.75 million for a whole floor office at the ACCI House building.

This sale at $19,388 a square metre beats the previous Melbourne record of $15,288 a square metre at 100 Collins Street.

Knight Frank's Jack De Lutis, Gellie Mendez and Andrew Hansen negotiated the deal for a local family that has owned the property for 25 years.

Also at 100 Flinders Street, private investors have traded a Level 2 strata office for $3.8 million.

Colliers International’s Anthony Kirwan, Chris Ling and Martin Leong sold the 317sq m office.

Taren Point sale

Advertisement

Private group Alexander Investment Holdings has purchased a 2314sq m Taren Point development site in Sydney's Sutherland shire for $5.1 million to build a multi-level warehouse development with smaller factory units.

Colliers International's Trent Gallagher and Edward McFarland sold the site at 60-62 Alexander Avenue for private owner Radiate.

Bowls rolls

The Enoggera Bowls Sports and Community Club has sold another retail and showroom strata unit at its redeveloped mixed-use property at 72 Pickering Street in Brisbane's north or $4.6 million.

A local investor bought the unit leased to Tradelink for seven years with options.

Enoggera Bowls redeveloped its property with retail and showroom units as well as a new bowls club to generate more income following falling member numbers.

JLL's Andrew Havig, Elliott O'Shea and Campbell Bowers closed the sale on a net yield of 6.26 per cent.

A private buyer has splashed out $6.9 million for a retail property at 99 Burwood Road in Sydney's Burwood. Mark Merton Photography

Advertisement

Record Burwood

A private buyer has splashed out $6.9 million for a retail property at 99 Burwood Road in Sydney's Burwood at auction, with the property selling for the first time in 35 years.

The 170.3sq m freehold shop is close to Burwood centre and high-density residential projects. It sold at a yield of 2.46 per cent.

CI Australia’s Nick Lowry marketed the property.

Submissions to stan@afr.com
description: Hodgson Partners has also paid $4.75 million for a whole floor office at 55 Exhibition Street in Melbourne's CBD.
